title: Thunderbird has problems notifying of unread eMail when folders are nested.
content:
When one has nested folders in a Thunderbird account the notification of unread mail is not being propagated up to ALL the folders in the chain to the head of the nest.

My Thunderbird often does not mark the account when new email has arrived.

When It does mark the account, all the folders underneath are UNmarked so one has to go on a fishing trip opening each containing folder until the unread email is highlighted.

eg:

An Account is sometimes marked as having unread email folder1 (no marking) subFolder1 (no marking) subfolder2 (no marking) subSubFolder (sometines marked) email is marked as unread folder2 subFolder1 subFolder2 subSubFolder3

folder3
creator: mozilla490

title: Getting Thunderbird error "Unable to open the summary file for Inbox on rsagun@gmail.com. Perhaps there was an error on disk, or the full path is too long."
content:
Running TB 115.5.2 32bit on a windows 11 pc Started getting the error: Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox.

I followed TB support article that directed me to find and erase the parent.lock file in the profiles subdirectory, which I did. Now I am getting this error and all of my emails are invisible to me: Unable to open the summary file for Inbox on rsagun@gmail.com. Perhaps there was an error on disk, or the full path is too long."

I restored the parent.lock file with the original file but no help.

Any suggestions?? Thank you. Ross
creator: rsagun

Esto solo me ocurre en thunderbird, en otros gestores me muestra el mensaje enviado correctamente

title: thunderbird outgoing mails
content:
Hi,

since 10 days it is impossible to send mails via Thunderbird (version 115.5.1) to the proximus (skynet) server. Incoming mails are still possible. After contacting Proximus and trying different settings of the outgoing server, the problem remains. Proximus told me that they need to increase the security and therefore an authentication is required which has not been succesful until now. Is there a setting in Thunderbird which could solve this problem? I tryed all the tips I found on the internet such as check the virus scan, check the firewall etc. but the problem remains.

Best regards

Annemie
creator: annemie.vergote2

title: Gesta myší
content: Dobrý den, chtěl jsem se zeptat, jestli je už nějaká možnost ovládat Thunderbird pomocí gest myší. Má v plánu Mozilla něco takového dovolit, případně implementovat přímo do sebe? Ovládání bez gest je pro mě hrozně pomalé, otravné. Z toho důvodu si stále držím verzi 52.9.1, což je poslední verze, která ovládání gesty povoluje.

title: Email appears in Outlook Inbox, says it's in my inbox, but it isn't there.
content:
Hi,

I have a strange issue. There's an email thread that appears in my Outlook web inbox but doesn't appear in Thunderbird.

When I search for the email, it appears in the search results, and it says that it's in the inbox, but it isn't.

When I removed all of the other messages from my inbox, as shown in the image below, it says that I still have 3 messages in my inbox, even though they don't appear.

It seems like there must be some filter applied, but I don't know where or what filter it is.

TIA!
creator: jdfoote1

title: Thread display under 115.5.1
content: I have been using TB for many years and use TB to read usenet posts only. Since the update, everything works well except one occasional problem. Sometimes a new post in a thread will result in the whole thread being shown with each post summarised in 2 or 3 lines. It is impossible to expaqnd the thread afaics or to read the full text of the new post. Even after clicking the thread shows as having unread messages. It is not possible to reply to any posts. I attach screenshots of 1 thread this afternoon both at the top and at the end (with lots of posts I scrolled past not shown) and another screenshot of what a new post normally looks like. THis seems entirely random. There is no pattern that I can dsiscern, it's not always the same user or a reply to the same user or always the same threads.
creator: rtilbury

title: Mensajes enviados en negrita

Muchas gracias.

title: Account migration issue for outgoing messages
content: When I got a new computer, my account was automatically set up as IMAP but I could not send emails, though I can receive on the IMAP version. I went into manual configuration and copied all the configuration information from my (working) old computer to it, using its POP3/SMTP settings, but when I Retest I get an error: 'Thunderbird failed to find the settings for your email account' I've double-checked everything and am at a standstill. I really need help!
creator: bduprey
